data.title: No smiles
data.text: When it comes to the owners who help you...there's no smiles or happiness. Maybe they should leave the service to their employees who put on a happier face than they do. Bagels are good here though.

data.title: Great Coffee & Bagels
data.text: Haven't driven down Pine Ave in awhile and what a transformation. 5th Ave Bagelry apparently has been there about 5 months now (across the street from Starbucks). Stopped in and had the 5th Avenue ($6.99) and the bagel was loaded with lox and goodies. Cafe Mocha was also very good ... No need to cross the street for Starbucks. Parking sucks on Pine Ave BUT meters are free until 9 am. Only a few other customers when I was there around 7:30 am. Lots of tables. Bagels were large and a nice selection. Will be back ... Often.

data.title: Great place for breakfast.
data.text:
We took the passport bus to downtown long Beach and found this place while walking around.   There is a huge selection of bagels in this shop all fresh and tasty.  They have the classic breakfast sandwiches as well as nice sandwiches for lunch
 They are all custom made for each customer
There are also washroom facilities for customers. I really enjoyed my breakfast here and would definitely stop for lunch if I was in the area

data.title: Great place for a fast and delicious breakfast
data.text: While it's a little walk from the conference center, it's definitely worth it. The selection and quality of the bagels were outstanding. Tran, the owner, as well as the rest of the staff were friendly, fast and efficient.
